docs.text: one night , during a torrential downpour that flooded the streets , we went to see -- what else -- hard rain .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " so , are we all going to die ? "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the sheriff ( randy quaid ) asks in the story's opening line as he evacuates his flooded town .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the answer is pretty much yes , but not nearly soon enough .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and to add insult to injury , the supposedly dead , regretfully , often turn out not to be so .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: populating this bad tv-movie-of-the-week material are a host of talented actors .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one can only hope they were rewarded handsomely for acting in this hopelessly muddled picture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: besides the obvious hardships of acting most scenes while dog paddling in the water , they will all receive black marks on their records for appearing in this dismal movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: graham yost's script serves up one cliche after another for the actors , who thankfully managed to mumble quite a few of the lines .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director mikael salomon's staging is so confusing that you may have trouble figuring out what is happening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the befuddled presentation is exacerbated by peter menzies , jr . 's dark and ugly cinematography .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot concerns an armored car that gets stuck in the raging water .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: onboard are guards tom and his uncle charlie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: christian slater , who is much better in his tender roles as in untamed heart , plays tom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: edward asner drops by briefly to take on the role of the soon to be dead charlie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: coming to their " rescue " is a gang headed by jim , played on autopilot by the great actor morgan freeman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he views the loot , three million dollars worth , as his retirement plan .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the entire movie is one big watery chase with the sheriff and his posse tracking jim and his gang , who are in turn after tom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way , tom picks up a love interest in the person of a crucifix-weapon wielding woman named karen , played in a totally wasted performance by minnie driver .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the action sequences are repetitive and without much interest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they do feature lots of explosions and gunfire to keep you awake .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: christopher young's emotionless score for the film has a single trait , ear-shattering loudness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot holes are as big as the ones in the dam that breaks , submerging the town .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the characters have an infinite number of bullets and rarely do they have to bother reloading their guns .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the weapons and the ammunition spend most of the time under water or being rained on but always fire perfectly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when one of the bad guys drops a gun into the water , it stays in the same place until much later when tom swims to get it , even though the swift water is so strong it is uprooting large trees .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: counting these improbabilities is one of the more enjoyable ways to spend your time as you wait for the characters to kill each other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the show has a single , but unprintable , good line .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: betty white plays an incessantly bossy wife , and , when her hen-pecked husband finally told her off , our audience roared with laughter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the show concludes with a sickening set of twists .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the best that can be said of the picture is that it is merely stupefyingly awful as opposed to laughably bad .
docs.label: negative
